body: Tentatively slated for 5.8 M1 for _team discussion_

rename.from: CsvSource always ignores trailing whitespaces with no way to configure behavior
rename.to: Provide mechanism to trim whitespace in @CsvSource and @CsvFileSource

body:
@sbrannen thanks! The title is not correct, which is my fault as my original title was not phrased right.
It should be `Provide mechanism to control whether or not to trim whitespace`
Exactly! Sorry I was not clear.

rename.from: Provide mechanism to trim whitespace in @CsvSource and @CsvFileSource
rename.to: Provide mechanism to control whether or not to trim whitespace in @CsvSource and @CsvFileSource

issue.title: feat(apply): implement @LoginApplicant

repository.name: service-apply
repository.description: 우아한테크코스 지원부터 최종 합격까지 모든 과정을 관리한다.

issue.body:
resolves #104, #114

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43440195/94556123-8fc06500-0297-11eb-87f8-af5fe84d6565.png)
위와 같이 컨트롤러의 메서드 파라미터에 `@LoginApplicant`를 붙이면 http 요청의 `Authorization` 헤더에 `Bearer ~~~`가 있나 확인해서 지원자를 불러오게 됩니다. 이 때, 토큰에 포함된 지원자의 이메일 정보를 활용합니다.



한 가지 유의해야헐 점은 인증에 실패하는 경우 등 예외가 발생하면 따로 처리해주는 곳이 없기 때문에 클라이언트에게 특정 응답을 내려주지않고 예외가 터지고 끝납니다. 추후 global exception handler가 구현되면 해결될 것 같습니다

body: **Team decision:** Introduce `ignoreTrailingAndLeadingWhitespace` attribute to `@CsvSource` and `@CsvFileSource` with default value of `true`.
@dmsergeevN26 Would you be interested in submitting a PR for this?
@marcphilipp i will give it a try
@somayaj is working on this issue in #2491.

issue.title: Provide mechanism to control whether or not to trim whitespace in @CsvSource and @CsvFileSource

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: ✅ The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

Added support for @CsvSource annotation.ignoreTrailingAndLeadingWhiteSpace property

Resolves #2420

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

---

### Definition of Done

- [X] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [ ] Method [preconditions](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org.junit.platform.commons/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [X] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [X] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [ ] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [ ] Change is documented in the [User Guide](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
- [X] All [continuous integration builds](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#continuous-integration-builds) pass
